Administration.text:
Type: Atypical
antipsychotic
Dosage Forms:
Routes of Administration: PO, IM
Common Trade Names: Geodon

Adult_Dosing.text:
Mania/psychosis: 40 to 80 mg PO BID
Acute agitation: 10-20mg IM q2-4h, 40mg max daily

Pediatric_Dosing.text: Age 10-17: slowly titrate up to  target dose 20-80mg BID

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: C
Lactation risk
: Infant risk cannot be ruled out
Renal dosing: no adjustment
Hepatic dosing: no adjustment

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
QT prolongation
, concomitant administration of other QT prolonging medications
Decompensated
heart failure
, recent
MI

Serious.text:
Prolonged QT, torsades de pointes, syncope
Neuroleptic malignant syndrome, tardive dyskinesia, seizure
Bone marrow depression
Dysphagia
Hyperglycemia, diabetes
Priapism

Common.text:
Extrapyramidal disease, dystonia, tremor, akathisia
Dizziness, asthenia, somnolence, anxiety
Nausea/vomiting, diarrhea, constipation
Weight gain
Rash
Visual changes
URI

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 2-7h
Metabolism: Hepatic: CYP3A4, and CYP1A2
Excretion: Mostly fecal

Mechanism_of_Action.text: D2 and 5HT2 antagonist. Also strong Î±-1 blocker, antihistamine-1.
